Description:
This unassuming diamond in the rough is a must see place to visit when in Pratt, Kansas.

The museum holds an amazing collection of artifacts (photographs, historical documents, collectables and even machinery) from a bygone era!

The displays relate to Pratt County, the town of Pratt and also the state of Kansas.

There are amazing displays of fossils and Indian items (arrowheads and dresses) along with collections of clothes, hats and shoes from the late 19th century into the 20th!

The museum, at first glance appears  deceptively small but in actuality, I believe it takes up most, if not all, of the square block it sits on!

So much so, that when I mentioned "machinery" I did not only mean stuff like toasters, typewriters and hand tools but also full on combine engines and John Deere tractors!

In addition, they have many storefronts like a bank, telephone, dentist office, etc., where you can go inside and view how it was set up in the past.

There is just too much at the museum to write it all here. Besides, I am sure that if I returned, I would see/notice stuff that I missed the first go around (and I was there for over 90 minutes).

Finally, a shout out to the very nice ladies that were "running" the museum! They were very nice to talk with and gave information as to what more to do while in Pratt!

Highly recommend!

Place Name: Kiowa County Historical Museum and Soda Fountain
Type: museum, tourist_attraction, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
Description: Milkshakes, ice cream, and other sweet treats are tasty. Short wait for food. The museum is interesting and talks about the history of Greensburg and surrounding towns.

There is much to see and learn here, and the curator is the one to talk to, as she is very well informed and more than willing to share her knowledge.

There is much more to Carry Nation and her campaigns then I ever knew. This is the place to visit if you're interested in that time of American history and culture!
Covered picnic tables provided shade. Some tables have bbq grills, too. A nice place to get out and stretch your legs on a long road trip.
Fun, but bring an umbrella because there is no shade. Easy to get to and a fun weekend.

Place Name: Rodeo Arena at Memorial Peace Park
Description: We had a fantastic time at the Buckapalooza during the Peace Treaty weekend. Highly recommended!
Had personal tour. It is very interesting, especially if your from central Kansas. Free, but donations accepted.
Bingo too

Surprised the Mrs with this awesome hand dug well. But when we got inside, I was surprised by the F5 tornado that came through Greensburg, Kansas. And all the pictures they had.
Well worth your time to come and see this one and mark where you came from on their map. ...   gotta love the people that come together and build everyone back together .  Special kind of love ‚ù§Ô∏è üòç

So much information, multiple trips will be needed to read and enjoy everything. I enjoyed the tour I recieved the night before the race and talking to all of the staff. Race was very good and it was just the first year so next year I can see the race being even more fun.

Pretty Neat little museum about the county.
Soda fountain was nice to get a treat at.
The roof top garden was neat to check out.

Place Name: Powwow Grounds at Memorial Peace Park
Description: We stumbled upon this place on a drive through the state. What an awesome place. We had a great time hiking around and exploring the grounds.
Tasteful roadside table with some signs about local history.
Those that have been following along know how much I love statuary parks. I saw this from The Big Well museum and initially thought it was a salute to forks. üòÖ

Place Name: Gypsum Hills Scenic Byway Info Kiosk
Description: You would not believe you're in Kansas. It's beautiful. This byway makes the drive absolutely enjoyable. Gorgeous!
